title: How does Mg react with hot water and cold water? - Quora

response.answer_text: When Mg was put into cold water, it will react slowly first and then there will be a capsule of Mg( OH)2, which would stop the react. The hot water will increase the solubility of Mg( OH)2 Another part is the Gibbs free energy of this reaction.
Mg + 2H2O = Mg(OH)2 + H2(g) Change in Enthalpy: ΔH(0C) = -340.2kJ Change in Enthalpy: ΔH(200C) = -364.8kJ However, Mg + H2O = MgO + H2(g) Change in Enthalpy: ΔH(200C) = -321.4kJ
